articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Protesters staged anti-Israel rallies around the Middle East on Wednesday, some of them turning violent, to voice rage at an explosion that killed hundreds of Palestinians at a hospital in the deadliest incident inside Gaza during the Israel-Hamas war.
articles.title: Gaza hospital explosion: Protests erupt across Middle East

articles.author: Dan Williams
articles.description: One Israeli cabinet minister was barred from a hospital visitors' entrance. Another's bodyguards were drenched with coffee thrown by a bereaved man. A third had "traitor" and "imbecile" shouted at her as she came to comfort families evacuated during the horror.
articles.title: Whatever unfolds in Gaza war, judgment day looms for Netanyahu

articles.author: Nayera Abdallah, Nadine Awadalla
articles.description: President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi said on Wednesday that Egyptians in their millions would reject the forced displacement of Palestinians into Sinai, adding that any such move would turn the Egyptian peninsula into a base for attacks against Israel.
articles.title: Egypt rejects displacement of Palestinians into Sinai, says Sisi

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United States vetoed a United Nations Security Council resolution on Wednesday that would have called for humanitarian pauses in the conflict between Israel and Palestinian Hamas militants to allow humanitarian aid access to the Gaza Strip.
articles.title: US vetoes UN Security Council action on Israel, Gaza

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Three Palestinians, including two teenagers, were killed by Israeli forces in separate incidents in the occupied West Bank early on Thursday, Palestinian official news agency WAFA said.
articles.title: Three Palestinians killed by Israeli forces in West Bank - WAFA news agency

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Lebanon's Hezbollah warned its adversaries on Wednesday it was "thousands of times stronger" than before, as its fighters exchanged fire at the border with Israeli forces in violence fuelled by the war between Hamas and Israel.
articles.title: Lebanon's Hezbollah says it is stronger than before as border clashes rage

articles.author: Ece Toksabay, Ali Kucukgocmen
articles.description: Turkish protesters staged fresh anti-Israel demonstrations on Wednesday as Turkey was set to declare three days of mourning following a blast that killed large numbers of Palestinians at a Gaza hospital.
articles.title: Fury grows in Turkey against Israel, fresh protests staged

articles.author: Samia Nakhoul, Matt Spetalnick, Alexander Cornwell
articles.description: Israel is vowing to wipe out Hamas in a relentless onslaught on the Gaza Strip but has no obvious endgame in sight, with no clear plan for how to govern the ravaged Palestinian enclave even if it triumphs on the battlefield.
articles.title: Israel's endgame? No sign of post-war plan for Gaza

articles.author: Stephanie Burnett, Stephen Farrell, Hardik Vyas
articles.description: As the Israel-Hamas war rages, regulators and analysts say a wave of online disinformation risks further inflaming passions and escalating the conflict in an electronic fog of war.
articles.title: Disinformation surge threatens to fuel Israel-Hamas conflict

articles.author: Liliana Salgado, Daniel Becerril
articles.description: The first U.S. deportation flight to Venezuela under a new Biden administration initiative landed in Caracas on Wednesday, as part of a tougher approach to border enforcement as the U.S. struggles with record illegal crossings.
articles.title: First U.S. deportation flight lands in Venezuela under new Biden crackdown
